sentence.Network_en: The myth of Narcissus is described in Ovid's work.
sentence.Network_cn: 有关那喀索斯的神话故事在奥维德的作品中有过描述。

sentence.Network_en: The sweet witty soul of Ovid lives in mellifluous and honey - tongued Shakespeare.
sentence.Network_cn: 奥维德的风雅机智的灵魂活在语言甜美流畅的莎士比亚身上.

sentence.Network_en: A story in Ovid will give you the necessary hints.
sentence.Network_cn: 奥维德的一个故事可以给你必要的提示.

means.word_mean: 1. Roman poet remembered for his elegiac verses on love (43 BC - AD 17)

auth_sentence.content: Like Ovid's Fasti, in hexameter and pentameter verses.
auth_sentence.res_content: Like Ovid's Fasti, in hexameter and pentameter verses.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Like Ovid's Fasti, in hexameter and pentameter verses.

auth_sentence.content: Joyce was fond of the line in Ovid Everything changes, nothing is lost.
auth_sentence.res_content: Joyce was fond of the line in Ovid Everything changes, nothing is lost.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Joyce was fond of the line in Ovid Everything changes, nothing is lost.

auth_sentence.content: He cited Ovid as having said this, and Meleager that, in praise of a fine head of hair.
